hero.title: Prizm
hero.subtitle: Finally, Agents WORK WITH you.
hero.description: Agent Collaborative Environment: A desktop productivity platform where Agents are elevated to peer status. Co-manage your knowledge base, tasks, and workflows seamlessly — truly an intelligence that works with you.

features.title: Core Features Overview
features.userDesc1: Data strictly lands in your local .prizm-data hidden directory. All digital assets are offline-first with local vector search models.
userList1: No Cloud Dependency: Local storage ensures absolute privacy.
Offline-First: Manage knowledge and tasks without internet.
Portable Workspace: Easily backup configuration and state.
features.userDesc2: A full-fledged markdown notes system that your Agents can read, write, and reference automatically.
userList2: Document Interactions: Full document CRUD handled natively by the agent.
Frontmatter Support: Organize metadata and tags seamlessly.
Context Injection: Let Agents attach relevant docs automatically via the @ syntax.
features.userDesc3: Eliminate rigid context-loss. Intelligent dynamic partitioning into short/mid/long term semantic memory.
userList3: Short-Term Context: Session boundaries and direct tool executions.
Mid-Term Dynamics: Scoped project vectors matching semantic flows.
Long-Term Core: Persistent SQLite + LanceDB attributes mapping your identity.
features.userDesc4: Let Agents browse the web for you. Fully integrated Chrome Remote Debugging Protocol.
userList4: Act & Extract: Agents can click, type, and extract structured data automatically.
Live Research: Search the live web and synthesize real-time results.
Visual Feedback: Live headless browser preview on your desktop client.
features.userDesc5: Build automated 24/7 digital employees to sort, draft, and remind you using an intuitive drag-and-drop builder.
userList5: DAG Workflow Engine: Multi-step pipeline node execution supporting parallel paths.
Cron Jobs: Seamless scheduling with visual schedule manager.
Human-In-The-Loop: Built-in notification interrupts for approval routing.
features.userDesc6: Built-in actionable Todo lists. Let your Agent decompose complex objectives into atomic steps.
userList6: Agent Decomposition: Ask the LLM to break down a big idea into 10 smaller todos.
Status Tracking: Seamlessly mark steps as in-progress or blocked.
Integrated Deadlines: Link action items into your calendar schedules.
features.userDesc7: Sub-second cross-workspace fetching powered by deeply optimized local-first vector retrieving, bridging endless notes.
userList7: Multi-Engine Unified Search: Merging Keyword, MiniSearch, and RipGrep engines.
Cross-Scope Indexing: Find anything across workspaces intelligently.
Vector Match: Powered directly through EverMemOS abstractions.
features.userDesc8: Electron-powered heavy native integrations giving your Agents unprecedented capabilities over your system.
userList8: Clipboard Monitoring: Agents can directly read or write to your OS clipboard.
Native Notifications: Agents can push deep OS notification alerts.
Terminal Access: Directly run scripts on your local system via Agent intent.
features.techDesc1: Multi-tenant logic mapping. Separate Personal, Work, and Sandbox data entirely natively.
techList1: Tenant Sandbox: Full separation across different 'Scope' directives.
Context Purging: Zero bleeding of session data or vector results across scopes.
Storage Separation: Files are strictly saved in distinct scope directories.
features.techDesc2: Enterprise-ready Model Context Protocol bridges, providing standardized endpoints to expose Prizm data.
techList2: Standard Stdio Streams: Native process bridging out-of-the-box for Cursor.
HTTP/SSE Exposure: Built-in protocol layer on port 4127 mapping directly to workspace contexts.
Two-Way Synergy: Become an MCP Client and host external MCP servers too.
features.techDesc3: A robust fencing mechanism ensuring parallel Agent executions do not destructively collide over the same documents.
techList3: Fencing Tokens: Uses incrementing fencing tokens with TTL heartbeats.
Optimistic Locking: Collisions avoided in real-time through SQLite 'resource_locks.db'.
Deadlock Recovery: Automatic garbage collection of orphaned Session locks.
features.techDesc4: High-speed WebSocket penetration for server-side terminal control. Allows real-time I/O echo updates bypassing HTTP poll lags.
techList4: Dual WS Ports: Distinguishing standard event messaging (/ws) from strict TTY streams (/ws/terminal).
Worker Pool: Terminal Executor Pool isolating multiple interactive task containers safely.
Reactive Render: Pushing raw buffer arrays directly to xterm wrappers in React.
features.techDesc5: Decoupled domain actions routed via scalable localized EventBus topologies avoiding spaghetti architectures.
techList5: Strict Typings: DomainEventMap parsing multi-level events strictly typed in TS.
Lifecycle Hooks: Event triggering guarantees side-effects like Memory Extracts trigger atomically.
Background Workers: Safely shifting heavy LLM extractions to non-blocking bus events.
features.techDesc6: Every core logic system is defined as an `IAdapter`, allowing frictionless future upgrades to new storage engines.
techList6: Dependency Injection: Overload Notification, TodoList, Document logic with generic Adapters.
Easily Mocked: Super simple testing suites by dropping in Memory-based mock adapters.
Storage Freedom: Swap out markdown flat-files for Postgres simply by writing a new DocumentAdapter.
features.techDesc7: Deep tracing of toolkit executions. Precision-level rollbacks utilizing unified checkpoints for complete undo operations.
techList7: Audit Stores: Aggregating 90-day retention trails for tool actions in 'agent_audit.db'.
Session Checkpoints: Automatic snapshotting before destructive actions for secure rollbacks.
Approval Halts: Strict 'interactManager' halting processing logic until human feedback completes.
features.techDesc8: Granular accounting parsing LLM streams natively across providers yielding maximum transparency.
techList8: Stream Interceptors: Accurate token calculating directly attached to AI SDK stream bridges.
Global Dashboard: Unified visualization across OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and local models.
Cost Limits: Implement budget constraints stopping runaway infinite loops.

mcp.title: Ecosystem Integration (MCP)
mcp.description: Prizm acts as an open personal hub. It allows direct exposure of local data and built-in instruction contexts as MCP sources to empower leading AI tool clients.
mcp.cursorDesc: Relies on standard pipeline communication mounting. Navigate to Cursor's remote options and specify the mounting command to securely access your Prizm workspace directly in your IDE.
mcp.lobechatDesc: Directly input the server address to expose the protocol interface. Supports passing isolation domain identity via URL Query parameters to differentiate independent workflows and contexts.
